pull.title: guix: Update `python-lief` package to 0.13.1
pull.body:
The usage of LIEF 0.13.1 in the developer environment has been assumed since https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27507.

This PR brings the same LIEF version to the Guix environment and drops the patch that was upstreamed.

Changes in `contrib/devtools/security-check.py` are caused by  https://github.com/lief-project/LIEF/commit/6357c6370bf102b580b8d65c3aad1c3010b0e07d.

events.body:

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#27811](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27811) (guix: Clean up manifest by hebasto)
* [#25573](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25573) ([POC] guix: produce a fully -static-pie x86_64 bitcoind using GCC and glibc by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

guix: Update `python-lief` package to 0.13.1

events.body:
> The usage of LIEF 0.13.1 in the developer environment has been assumed since https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27507.

The only requirement to have LIEF 0.13.1 installed, is if you want to run the Python linter, which is not a reason to bump packages in our release environment. Outside of that, I don't think LIEF is used for anything in developer environments.

> ... which is not a reason to bump packages in our release environment.

"and drops the patch that was upstreamed."
